word: There was silence in heaven; no harp was touched. They see their Lord enclosed by legions of satanic forces, His human nature weighed down with a shuddering, mysterious dread. . . . Strengthened by the angel sent from heaven, Jesus arises in sweat and blood and agony and for the third time returns to His disciples. . . . But He was disappointed. He found them sleeping in the hour of His bitterest agony. And the sight made angels grow sad. . . . Prophecy had declared that the “Mighty One”. . . was to tread the winepress alone; “of the people there was none” with Him.—Manuscript 42, 1897.
